oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Charley Pride - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Charley Pride (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date. Tape is labeled part one of two.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Charley Pride; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Charley Pride commercial spot for the Hallmarks of Country Music program -- (00:11)All I Have to Offer You Town [featuring Charley Pride and Rick Phillips voiceover] (Charley Pride) -- (00:42) Kiss an Angel Good Mornin' [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] (Charley Pride) -- (00:54) Let the Chips Fall (Charley Pride) -- (01:16) Hallmarks of Country Music introduction tune [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:55) Just Between You and Me (Charley Pride) -- (04:01) U. S. Department of Transportation commercial tune ([Unidentified]) -- (05:01) Kiss an Angel Good morning (Charley Pride) -- (07:03) Rick Phillips introduces Pride, and both reflect on the progression of country music from its early stages -- (08:55) I Know One (Charley Pride) -- (11:17) Cal Smith reflects on his time as a chef in the military -- (11:50) Snakes Crawl at Night (Charley Pride) -- (14:30) Unidentified voice gives an update on maternity military clothing -- (14:55) Mississippi Cotton Pickin' Delta Town (Charley Pride) -- (17:16) Pride is asked by Phillips to reflect on his personal connection to "Mississippi Cotton Pickin' Delta Town" -- (18:40) Phillips inquires about Pride's first response to hearing country music -- (19:23) Phillips and Pride discuss Pride's impression of his chances he would become prominent -- (21:45) Does My Ring Hurt Your Finger (Charley Pride) -- (24:02) Military commercial spot by an unidentified host -- (24:57) The Easy Part's Over Now (Charley Pride) -- (28:20) Phillips inquires as to Pride's time in Montana that came about due to baseball -- (31:02) Let the Chips Fall (Charley Pride) -- (33:41) Military commercial spot by an unidentified host -- (34:28) Kaw-Liga (Charley Pride) -- (37:39) The Day the World Stood Still (Charley Pride) -- (39:55) Phillips introduces how the New York Mets and the Los Angeles Angels had an opportunity to sign Pride -- (44:03) All I Have to Offer You is Me (Charley Pride) -- (47:06) Phillips performs a military commercial spot -- (47:39) American Cancer Society commercial spot hosted by Edward Asner -- (48:36) Wonder Could I Live There Anymore (Charley Pride) -- (51:04) Phillips inquires about the similarities between baseball and touring -- (53:00) Is Anybody Going to San Antone (Charley Pride) -- (55:15) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
